info.title: Automox API
info.description:
The Automox API is a powerful interface that allows you to integrate Automox reporting data into you applications and control the various settings of your account.

All endpoints are only accessible via https and are located at
`api.automox.com`. For instance: you can see events associated with your account by accessing the following URL with your ID:
(replace API-KEY with your own):
```
  https://console.automox.com/api/events?api_key=API-KEY
```
## Limits
Be nice. If you're sending too many requests too quickly, we'll send back a
`429` error code (Too Many Requests).
You are limited to 5000 requests per hour per `api_key` overall. Practically, this means you should (when possible) authenticate
users so that limits are well outside the reach of a given user.

get.description: Gets all `Event` objects for the authenticated user.
Gets a specific `Event` object for the authenticated user.
Gets all organizations for the api key
Returns all software packages discovered on all servers (endpoints) of an organization
Gets all `Policy` objects for authenticated user
Gets a specific `Policy` object for the authenticated user.

post.description: Schedule a policy for immediate remediation

get.description: Gets all `Policy Set` objects for authenticated user
Gets all `Policy Stats` objects for authenticated user
Gets all `Server` objects for authenticated user
Gets a specific `Server` object for the authenticated user.
Returns the command queue for the specified server (endpoint)
Returns the command queue for the specified server (endpoint)

post.description: Issue a command to an endpoint. Can be used to install a specific set of patches or reboot an endpoint

get.description: Gets all `Server Group` objects for authenticated user
Gets a specific `Server Group` object for the authenticated user.
Retrieves software packages and patches for an organization, specific policy, or just those that need [approval | attention | exceptions | pending update].

parameters.name: policyId
parameters.description: Return results for a specific Policy ID

parameters.name: exceptions
parameters.description: Retrieve software that applies to exception endpoints

parameters.name: pendingUpdate
parameters.description: Retrieve software that is pending update

get.description: Retrieves software packages and patches for an organization, allows filtering the list of software by name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of software package (wildcards ok) i.e. *KB12345*

parameters.name: groupID
parameters.description: Return software for a given group ID

put.description: Update a manual approval record. Set `manual_approval` attribute of `approval` object to `true` to approve a patch; set it to `false` to reject a patch

get.description: Gets all `User` objects for the authenticated user.
Gets all commands executed for specified user id
Retrieve the prepatch report
Retrieve the non compliant devices report
